div.p: All Fitzgerald Public Schools are closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year during the COVID-19 Pandemic.

li.class: menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom current-menu-item current_page_item menu-item-2374

a.title: Click to learn more about our Budget and Salary/Compensation Report
Click to learn more about MI School Data

div.p: The Coronavirus School Closure Information page is dedicated to providing up-to-date information on the coronavirus across federal, state, county, and district levels. This page will provide communication, instructional resources and community resources.

It is necessary for Fitzgerald Public Schools to change our food distribution schedule. We WILL continue to provide a FREE grab-n-go breakfast and lunch for students up to age 18. Food distribution will take place each Friday beginning April 17, 2020. Click here for more details!

Although the Governor has closed our schools for the remainder of the 19-20 school year, Fitzgerald’s unlimited Schools of Choice window remains OPEN! You can request a SOC Application for the 20-21 school year, by calling 586-757-1750 or emailing Analisa Collins at anacol@myfitz.net. Once completed, SOC application packets can be returned to Fitzgerald Public Schools via U.S. Mail to Analisa Collins, Superintendent’s Office , 23200 Ryan Road, Warren, MI 48091 or placed in our Drop Box located in front of the Automotive Tech Building behind Fitzgerald High School.

img.alt: schools of choice enrollment open now
schools of choice enrollment open now

div.p: To ensure Michigan receives nearly $30 billion in federal funding, everyone living in our state must be counted in the 2020 Census. Help us spread the word about the importance of completing the 2020 Census!
For the convenience of our students and staff, we are announcing some key dates for the upcoming 2020/2021 school year!
Thank you to our community for voting to improve the future of Fitzgerald Public Schools! Please visit our 2019 bond page for up-to-date information regarding the bond.
Our number one priority is ensuring a safe and welcoming environment for all students, staff and visitors. Click on the School Safety link for important information.
Fitzgerald Public Schools is committed to the safety and security of our students. Please click here for a letter from the Superintendent

div.h2: Learn About Fitzgerald’s Enrichment Programs & Activities

div.p: What makes a well-rounded Fitzgerald student? Click the photo to watch our video that highlights our unique programs and curriculum

Our students, families and teachers love being a part of the welcoming environment we offer at Fitzgerald Public Schools. Click the photo to watch our video to see what it’s like to be a part of the Fitzgerald Family!

div.h2: Fitzgerald students are college and career ready

div.p: Fitzgerald offers a wide range of options to prepare students for college and careers. We offer a full slate of Science Technology Engineering and Math (STEM) programs. We also offer on-site career-technical certifications in automotive repair, pharmacy technology and physical therapy. Click the image for a video tour of our STEM programs.

div.h2: New elementary science and reading curriculum

div.p: Fitzgerald elementary students will learn reading and science through a new, cutting-edge curriculum that aligns with Common Core State Standards. The programs take advantage of our one-to-one technology and they get students to solve real-world problems.

img.alt: A young student touching a tablet device
A young student touching a tablet device
